thread.title: Activists attach 'Refugees Welcome' banner to Statue of Liberty
thread.title_full: Activists attach 'Refugees Welcome' banner to Statue of Liberty

author: NICOLE HENSLEY
title: Activists attach 'Refugees Welcome' banner to Statue of Liberty
text:
Travel ban protesters attach 'Refugees Welcome' banner to Statue of Liberty Activists attach 'Refugees Welcome' banner to Statue of Liberty A band of activists attached the red "Refugees Welcome" banner to the Statue of Liberty base and it stayed up for at least an hour Tuesday. (Vit�ria Londero via Instagram)   8:58 PM 
Daring activists strapped a "Refugees Welcome" banner to the Statue of Liberty on Tuesday. 
National Park Service spokesman Jerry Willis said the 3-by-20-foot banner was hung from the public observation deck at the top of the statue's pedestal and taken down after about an hour. 
Park rules prohibit anything fixed to the copper colossal, Willis said. 
A man claiming to be behind the stunt told Fusion that President Trump's stalled travel ban against seven predominantly Muslim countries inspired the inclusive banner. 
Mayor de Blasio rips feds for deporting Queens immigrant 
“I would imagine that the National Park Service staffers who also make this country great who are working there — I would be surprised if anyone who cares about the history of the Statue of Liberty did not agree with what we were saying," the activist said, only identifying himself as David. 
He said the banner was still attached to the statue as they left on the ferry. 
The banner appeared a day after the Department of Homeland Security announced expanded immigration enforcement policies. 
With News Wire Services.
